alert.note: Alert for Kane (Utah) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued June 26 at 4:50PM MDT until June 26 at 7:00PM MDT by NWS Saltlake
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 PM MDT THIS EVENING FOR CENTRAL KANE COUNTY... At 450 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rainfall occurred over the drainages earlier this afternoon. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of normally dry washes and streams. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Last Chance Creek from the headwaters to Lake Powell and Croton Canyon. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. In hilly terrain there are hundreds of low water crossings which are potentially dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to cross flooded roads. Find an alternate route. Remain alert for flooding even in locations not receiving rain. Dry washes, streams, and rivers can become raging killer currents in a matter of minutes, even from distant rainfall.
